data.text: @gak_pdx @JHeatherbell For sure. The heather dude is the detached one. I live in the Bay Area. Not even the most hippy places want to keep up masking. It’s midterms soon! Science hasn’t changed, but the dems gotta do something with those lackluster presidential approval ratings.
@gak_pdx Sure, it’s just interesting at least to me, that the number of people dying from Covid isn’t really dropping off and this is now considered the baseline. I dunno what I expected.

@gak_pdx I am in aviation. Hunters are always flying places with their rifles. It’s seasonal, fewer this time of year, way more in the fall. They have to open them up to put the travel paperwork in the case. Some pretty fancy kit out there.

@JacobEthanWhite That last line sounds a bit derisive, but that is what we are doing... because we do that about literally everything. It all has a risk:reward ratio that we collectively decide is acceptable.
The alternative has no limiting factor and basically is a recipe for social paralysis

@JHeatherbell Where the hell do you work?
It doesn't sound boring... 25+ rifles? Sounds like a party!

@gak_pdx It’s… an experience. Mostly people are really nice. But you run into the statistics way more than I expected. For example, every day I see:

- at least one medical
- at least one super drunk person
- 2-10 people with expired IDs
- 25+ rifles
- I pet 10+ cute doggos =D
@gak_pdx @JHeatherbell I’m glad your mom did okay. My dad didn’t do so well. Maybe that’s part of the difference in our perspectives.

@gak_pdx Sure. Omicron spiked here a good month after it did nationally. Figure we got a good couple of months before the next variant wave starts building momentum. Hopefully not though.

But hey I guess we’re collectively deciding how many deaths per day is worth getting back to normal.
@JHeatherbell Honestly, if it were me... dealing with being around 1k-3k people a day would be a bigger issue than COVID. I mean, the general public? Awful!
